document.masterDocTitle: Osmiine bees of the genus Haetosmia (Megachilidae, Osmiini): biology, taxonomy and key to species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Osmiine bees of the genus Haetosmia (Megachilidae, Osmiini): biology, taxonomy and key to species

materialsCitation.treatmentCitationGroup:
Osmia ( Haetosmia ) circumventa
Peters 1974 : 297
. Type material: Holotype ♂ , “ Gran Canaria , Maspalomas , Dünen , 14 –
18.4.1973
” ( Canary Islands ), Senckenberg Frankfurt.

Distribution. From the Canary Islands (Gran Canaria, Fuerteventura, Lanzarote) and northern Africa (southern Morocco , Libya , Egypt , Mauritania , Niger , Sudan ) eastwards to southern Israel and the Arabian Peninsula ( Saudia Arabia, Oman , United Arab Emirates ) ( Fig. 9 ).

Pollen hosts. Narrowly oligolectic on
Heliotropium
, e.g.
H. ramosissimum
(
Hohmann et al . 1993
;
Gotlieb et al. 2014
). Additional flower record:
Neurada procumbens
( Neuradaceae ) ( Peters 1974 ).

Notes. Based on the available data (see literature and new records above),
H. circumventa
has probably at least two generations per year on the Canary Islands, in the United Arab Emirates and possibly also in northern Africa. The appressed white pilosity on head, mesosoma and metasoma differs in extent and density among different populations of
H. circumventa
; it is most strongly developed in populations of the Arabian Peninsula and least developed in populations of the Canary Islands and Morocco.
